place_of_publication.publication_title: in C. F. P. von Martius et al.,Historia Naturalis Palmarum

treatment.description: Leaves: segment apices lax. Inflorescences with single primary axis and 3 orders of branching. Fruits usually oblong or olive-shaped (rarely globose), ripening from green to blue-green. 2n = 36.
treatment.discussion: Livistona chinensis is nNaturalized in Florida (E. H. Butts 1959).
treatment.global_distribution: native to Asia (southern China, Bonin Islands).

references.heading: SELECTED REFERENCE
references.reference: Butts, E. H. 1959. Livistona chinensis naturalized in Florida. Principes 3: 133.
